creator.name: Britse tussenbesturen
creator.his_func:
Between 1796 and 1816 the Netherlands Antilles, Suriname, Essequibo, Demerara and Berbice were occupied by the British:
Curaçao, Aruba and Bonaire, from 1800 to 1802 and from 1807 to 1816.
Saba, St Eustatius and St Martin from 1801 to 1802 and from 1810 to 1816.
Suriname from 1799 to 1802 and from 1804 to 1816.
Essequibo, Demerara and Berbice from 1796 to 1802 and continuously from 1803, a situation that was confirmed by the Treaty of London on August 13, 1814, regulating a formal transfer of sovereignty.
The British governors retained the Dutch administrative structure largely as it was.
creator.Aantekeningen:
Zelf

Pilot

Records relating to these (Dutch) regions are to be found in the British departments of Colonial Office (CO) and War Office (WO).
